thread.title: Every Stan Lee Marvel cameo
thread.title_full: Every Stan Lee Marvel cameo - Business Insider

author: Anjelica Oswald
title: Every Stan Lee Marvel cameo

organizations.name: deadpool stan lee captain america civil war marvel

text:
Is that Hugh Hefner? Nah, it's Stan Lee! Marvel/Paramount Pictures
Marvel may include multiple universes across TV and film, but one thing unites them all: the Stan Lee cameo.
Lee is an unrivaled legend in the comics world and the former president and chairman of Marvel Comics. His creative work began in 1939 and includes hugely recognizable characters like Spider-Man, Iron Man, Hulk, Thor, and the X-Men.
The 94-year-old icon has subtly appeared in all manner of Marvel media, from narrating "The Incredible Hulk" TV series in 1982 to briefly appearing in movies including "Deadpool."
"Guardians of the Galaxy" director James Gunn had the pleasure of filming Lee's next few Marvel cameos starting with "Doctor Strange." In honor of his most recent cameos ahead of "Logan" and in "Iron Fist," we've compiled a list of all of his live-action (and one very special animated) cameos in Marvel projects. Keep reading to see if you can recall them all.
Sidney Fussell originally contributed to an earlier version of this post.
View As: One Page Slides Stan Lee's first live-action cameo was as a jury member in the TV movie "The Trial of the Incredible Hulk" (1989). Marvel/NBC His first cinematic Marvel cameo was as a hot dog vendor in "X-Men" (2000). Marvel/20th Century Fox He showed up as a surprised bystander who saved a little girl from debris in "Spider-Man" (2002). Youtube/20th Century Fox A young Matt Murdock saves a distracted Lee from walking into traffic in "Daredevil" (2003). Marvel/20th Century Fox Lee and former Hulk actor Lou Ferrigno were security guards in 2003's "Hulk." Marvel/Universal Pictures He saves a woman from rubble while Spider-Man clashes with Doc Ock in "Spider-Man 2" (2004). Marvel/Columbia Pictures In "Fantastic Four" (2005), Lee appears as mailman Willie Lumpkin, a character he created in the comics. Marvel/20th Century Fox Lee gets extremely weirded out when Jean Grey begins using her telekinesis in "X-Men: The Last Stand" (2006). Marvel/20th Century Fox Lee is a wedding crasher in 2007's "Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer" who is turned away at the entrance. Marvel/20th Century Fox He comes across Peter Parker in Times Square in 2007's "Spider-Man 3." Marvel/Columbia Pictures Tony Stark mistakes Lee for Hugh Hefner in 2008's "Iron Man." Marvel/Paramount Pictures Here he is grabbing a drink in 2008's "The Incredible Hulk." Marvel/Universal Pictures In a nod to his original "Iron Man" cameo, Tony mistakes Lee for Larry King in "Iron Man 2" (2010). Marvel/Paramount Pictures Lee unsuccessfully tries to drag Thor's hammer with his pickup truck in the first "Thor" (2011). Marvel/Paramount Pictures In "Captain America: The First Avenger," Lee plays a WWII general at a press conference for Cap. (2011) Marvel/Paramount Pictures Lee pops up in a newsreel as a chess player being interviewed in the first "Avengers" movie (2012). Marvel/Disney Lee's second cameo in the first "Avengers" movie was cut for time, but in the deleted scenes he's having lunch next to Captain America and urges him to get the waitress' number. Marvel/Disney Lee grooves out to classical music while Spider-Man and the Lizard battle behind him in "The Amazing Spider-Man" (2012). Marvel/Columbia Pictures Lee gives a beauty contestant a perfect "10" in "Iron Man 3" (2013). Marvel/Disney He appears as a patient in a mental institution in 2013's "Thor: The Dark World." Marvel/Disney Lee is a security guard who loses Captain America's costume (Cap stole it) in "Captain America: The Winter Soldier" (2014). Marvel/Disney Lee attends Peter's graduation during 2014's "The Amazing Spider-Man 2." Marvel/Columbia Pictures Rocket Raccoon spies him in 2014's "Guardians of the Galaxy" flirting with a young woman. Marvel/Disney Okay, so this isn't live-action, but he made his first animated cinematic cameo in 2014's "Big Hero 6" as Fred's father. Marvel/Disney That same year, he played a stranger on a train in an episode of ABC's tie-in show "Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D." ABC He also appeared in the first season of ABC's "Agent Carter," alongside Tony's dad, Howard Stark in 2015. ABC Lee pops up as a military vet in "Avengers: Age of Ultron" (2015) who must be carried away after getting too drunk on Asgardian liquor at a victory party. Marvel/Disney He's a grizzled, yet friendly bartender in "Ant-Man" (2015). Marvel/Disney Stan Lee's "Deadpool" (2016) cameo is as raunchy as the film itself. Lee appears as an emcee at a strip club. Marvel/20th Century Fox In "Captain America: Civil War" (2016), Lee appears in one of the final scenes as a Fed-Ex deliveryman, with a package for Tony Stark. Marvel/Disney In "X-Men: Apocalypse" (2016), he stands with his real wife Joan during a scene where Apocalypse uses his powers to launch all the world's nuclear weapons into space, essentially disarming the entire planet. Marvel/20th Century Fox He appears in the final episode of the first season of Netflix's "Daredevil" series in a photograph on the back wall (2015). Netflix When Jessica Jones visits the same station in "Jessica Jones" (2015), with a surprise appearance from nemesis Kilgrave, we see the same photo of Lee as an officer. Netflix In Netflix's latest series "Luke Cage," you can spot the same photo of Stan Lee on a poster saying, "See a crime? Report it!", when Luke spots a robbery in progress. Netflix In "Doctor Strange," Stan Lee pops up on a bus in New York City reading a copy of "The Doors of Perception." Walt Disney Studios/Marvel It's one of four cameos Lee reportedly filmed in one day. The others were for "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2" (2017), "Spider-Man: Homecoming" (2017), and "Thor: Ragnarok" (2017).
Source: LA Times
Though Stan doesn't pop up in "Logan," he was involved with a little "Deadpool" teaser that aired before the movie played. His part was cut from the theatrical version, but it's online. YouTube/IGN You can check out the full "Deadpool" sequel teaser here .
Eagle-eyed viewers spied Lee once again as an officer on a poster in "Iron Fist's" 13th episode. Marvel/Netflix Read the original article on INSIDER . Follow INSIDER on Facebook . Copyright 2017. Follow INSIDER on Twitter .
